intro: Pogonotrophe rigida, commonly known as the rigid pogonotrophe, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
